column2: The climate change and migration research specialist will be part of an interdisciplinary team of researchers working on climate change and migration, and responsible for anchoring field engagements in Kochi      As part of the team, the incumbent s involvement will include planning and execution of fieldwork that comprises qualitative and quantitative methods with a focus on climate-induced migrations      S/he will conduct life history interviews and key informant interviews, organise workshops and stakeholder engagement activities, and build local networks      The role requires working closely with local partner/s in Kochi to coordinate field tasks                This is a contractual position for an initial term of 11 months, renewable on mutual consent.            Activities and Tasks          Assisting with the development and implementation of research tools and instruments;      Contributing towards literature reviews and background research as needed;      Conducting field research activities as assigned, including:      Life history interviews with migrants from Odisha;      Semi-structured and in-depth interviews with key stakeholders;      Observing community dynamics, organising group discussions and facilitating meaningful dialogue;      Developing and using creative tools during multi-stakeholder events;          Maintaining detailed field notes and records of research activities; transcribing interviews;      Preparing data for analysis by cleaning, coding, and entering information into spreadsheets;      Collaborating with the IIHS Media Lab and Word Lab teams to ensure effective data collection and evidence building; create audio-visual content and develop material for wider dissemination; support website development and website updates;      Providing support in identifying the need for, and organising, workshops and stakeholder consultations at multiple locations in India;      Providing support to other IIHS activities including academics, research, training, practice, operations, and institution building at IIHS; carrying out tasks as assigned by IIHS; and travelling on IIHS work within the country as and when needed.              Structure and Reporting        The climate change and migration research specialist will be an External Consultant coordinating with the Senior Research Consultant - Practice at IIHS and will be required to collaborate effectively with a diverse group of internal teams and network partners.            Person Specification        The ideal candidate should have:        A master s degree in social work, social science, development studies, rural development, environmental studies, or related discipline;      Experience in conducting qualitative and/or participatory data collection (e.g., focus group discussions) and administering quantitative household surveys;      Previous experience in working on migration and with migrant communities;      Familiarity with the Odisha state and its migratory trends, including its socio-cultural and political landscape;      Language proficiency in: Odiya, Hindi, and English.
